quiz.title: System Classification
quiz.subtitle: Unit 7 Quiz 2: Consistent, Inconsistent, and Dependent Systems
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Identifying Types of Linear Systems Based on Solutions

questions.question: What type of system has exactly one solution?
questions.explanation: Consistent = has at least one solution. Independent = exactly one unique solution. So 'consistent and independent' means one solution.

questions.question: What type of system has no solution?
questions.explanation: Inconsistent systems have no solution (parallel lines that never intersect).

questions.question: What type of system has infinitely many solutions?
questions.explanation: Dependent systems have infinitely many solutions (same line graphed twice). They are still 'consistent' (have solutions).

questions.question: Classify: $y = 3x - 2$ and $y = 3x + 4$
questions.explanation: Both have slope 3 but different y-intercepts (-2 vs 4), so parallel lines = no solution = inconsistent.

questions.question: Classify: $2x - y = 5$ and $4x - 2y = 10$
questions.explanation: Second equation is exactly twice the first (same line). Same line = infinite solutions = dependent.

questions.question: Classify: $x + y = 7$ and $2x - y = 5$
questions.explanation: Different slopes (slopes are -1 and 2), so they intersect at exactly one point = consistent and independent.

questions.question: Classify: $3x + 2y = 6$ and $6x + 4y = 18$
questions.explanation: Second equation would be $6x+4y=12$ if dependent (2× first). But it's 18, so same slope but different intercepts = parallel = inconsistent.

questions.question: What does it mean if two lines are perpendicular?
options: They intersect at exactly one point but not at right angles
questions.explanation: Perpendicular lines intersect at 90° angles. Their slopes multiply to -1 (negative reciprocals).

questions.question: Classify: $y = -\frac{1}{2}x + 3$ and $y = 2x - 1$
questions.explanation: Slopes are -1/2 and 2. They are negative reciprocals (-1/2 × 2 = -1), so perpendicular = intersect at one point = consistent and independent.

questions.question: Classify: $4x - 2y = 8$ and $-2x + y = -4$
questions.explanation: Multiply second equation by -2: $4x - 2y = 8$, which is identical to first equation. Same line = dependent.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You master system classification: consistent/inconsistent, independent/dependent, and special cases like parallel/perpendicular.
scoreMessages.70: Strong classification skills! Focus on: 1) Comparing slopes and intercepts, 2) Recognizing same lines (dependent), 3) Identifying parallel lines (inconsistent).
scoreMessages.50: Good progress. Key concepts: 1) One solution = consistent independent, 2) No solution = inconsistent (parallel), 3) Infinite solutions = consistent dependent.
scoreMessages.0: Start by comparing slopes: Same slope? Check intercepts: Same = dependent (infinite solutions), Different = inconsistent (no solution). Different slopes = consistent independent (one solution).
